授業目的: The purpose of this course is to introduce the political history of prewar Japan. In order to accomplish this, we will utilize a standard text that deals with the critical period of the 1930s. One important aspect of the course is to understand how domestic politics can serve as a function of foreign policy. Therefore students will also also be exposed to basic concepts of diplomatic history in addition to political history. Upon completion of this course, students will have gained a deeper and much richer insight into Japanese politics of the Meiji, Taisho, and pre-1941 Showa periods.
到達目標: The learning goals of this course is to  understand the key concepts and events in prewar Japanese political history particularly during the pivotal period of the 1930s. In addition to politics, the area of diplomacy, economics, and security will also be examined. Japan's challenge to the established world order and the road to Pearl Harbor will be the prominent themes of the course. Students will also be exposed to basic concepts of military history. Upon completion of this course, students will have gained a deeper and much richer insight into Japan's political decision making process.
